question: Which country is endemic and native to the critically endangered species such as "False green robber frog" and "Eleutherodactylus parapelates"?
explanation: Haiti is endemic and native to the critically endangered species such as "False green robber frog" and "Eleutherodactylus parapelates". The false green robber frog (Eleutherodactylus chlorophenax) is a species of frogs in the family Eleutherodactylidae. It is endemic to the Massif de la Hotte, southwestern Haiti. Eleutherodactylus parapelates is a species of frog in the family Eleutherodactylidae. It is endemic to the Massif de la Hotte in southwestern Haiti. Common names Casillon robber frog and Macaya burrowing frog have been proposed for it.
